entries.name: Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Feat
entries: You gain one feat of your choice

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tabaxi have lifespans equivalent to humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tabaxi are taller on average than humans and relatively slender. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Feline Agility
entries: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Cat's Talents
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

entries.name: Water Lover
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other standard language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves physically mature at the same rate as humans, but theyâ€™re considered young until they reach the age of 80. On average they live about 400 years and a maximum of 500.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't descern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer and warhammer.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tool of your choice: Smith's Tools, Brewer's Supplies or Mason's Tools.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Children of the Stone
entries: You have resistance against fire damage, and are unaffected by extreme heat conditions.

entries.name: Stand Your Ground
entries: When an effect forces you to move - through a pull, a push, or a slide - you can move a square less than the effect specifies. This means an effect that normally pulls, pushes, or slides a target a square does not force you to move unless you want to. In addition, when an attack would knock you prone, you can immediately make a saving throw to avoid falling prone, DC 10 on regular terrain, DC 15 on difficult terrain.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnomes mature at the same rate Humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 200 to almost 300 years.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dim and dark conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against spells.

entries.name: Reactive Stealth
entries: If you have cover or concealment from all enemies when you make an Initiative check, you can make a Stealth check.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Gnomish. The Gnomish language, which uses the Dwarvish script, is renowned for its technical treatises and its catalogs of knowledge about the natural world.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Halfling's Iron Belly
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison and disease, you also have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Lost in the Crowd
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC when you are adjacent to at least two creatures larger than you.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. The Halfling language isn't secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don't have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond the physical growth to encompass wordly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 60 and can live to be 400 years old.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Elven Eyes
entries: You grant non-elf allies within 10ft of you a bonus to their Perception checks equal to half of your Perception modifier. You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Inner Beast
entries: All elves are born with the ability to shift their form to that of a single beast. These beasts are primarily peaceful forms (herbivores), though it isn't unheard of for an elf to manifest a more aggressive form (carnivore). You may change your form to that of your Inner Beast a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, each day. Follow the rules of the Druid's Wild Shape ability as to what happens to your stats and what you can do. Your Inner Beast does not have a duration though it ends if you are unconscious, or choose to end it.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intotations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Hellish Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Infernal Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell hellish rebuke} spell as a 2nd-level spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Dwarven Armor Training
entries: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Speak with Small Beasts
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets. Additionally you can cast the spell {@spell speak with animals} once per long rest.

entries.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

entries.name: Tinker
entries: You have proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|phb}). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.
When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Clockwork Toy
entries: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

entries.name: Fire Starter
entries: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

entries.name: Music Box
entries: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.
